title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Kevin Rue-Albrecht, Computational Biologist (Dipl. Ing., Ph.D.)

Education


2011-2015


DPhil, Computational Infection Biology


University College Dublin (Ireland)


Thesis: Comparative systems biology analyses of the bovine transcriptional response to species of the Mycobacterium genus.




2008-2011


Ingénieur diplômé


École Polytechnique Universitaire Polytech Nice-Sophia (France)


Major: Bioinformatics and Modelling for Biology




2006-2008


Class Préparatoire aux Grandes Écoles BCPST-Véto


Lycée Jean Rostand, Strasbourg (France)


‘BCPST’: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Earth Sciences




Research Experience


2020-present


Computational Biologist & Biomedical Data Science Trainer


Sims Group (University of Oxford)


Leading computational biology research and training programs in functional genomics and single-cell sequencing technologies.

title: Kevin Rue-Albrecht
text:
I am a computational biologist and biomedical data science trainer at the University of Oxford, with a focus on functional genomics and single-cell sequencing.
I actively collaborate on a range of research projects, predominantly applying single-cell analysis to diverse biological questions.
Inspiration from these collaborations drives my development of research software, with a particular emphasis on interactive data visualisation.
I am also an active contributor to the Bioconductor project, where I develop and maintain R packages together with the community.
